review_detailed_main:
"How do you like those peepers b*tch?!"

Jeepers Creepers Reborn is the latest unheard of entry in the Jeepers Creepers series. Reborn plays more as a remake in a way rather than a sequel to the first three films. It's not necessarily a remake only because it mentions the existence of the films in this film so it basically treats itself as the real deal. Let's put it this way, it's the furthest thing from ever being the real deal. If you thought Jeepers Creepers 3 was bad and didn't think it could sink any lower, somehow this movie does that. This movie is pure trash on every single level imaginable. The cgi is so bad that you would think they just started post production one day before the films release. It's honestly astonishing how awful the cgi is. There's literally a scene the cgi doesn't render and you could literally see the green screen as the car door opens. If the creeper has ever frightened you in any of the first three films then unfortunately get ready to laugh at this one because he's a sniffing old weak b*tch in this outing. I'm seriously baffled at how awful this film was. The only reason it exists is because the writer/director of the first three films did some awful things we don't need to speak of and so they just flat out canceled that storyline and thought this would be an acceptable replacement. The acting is terrible, the plot is Hell Fest meets the Creeper, and somehow the cgi looked worse than it did in the 90s/early 2000s. Normally I'd say stay far away from this, but I also want you all to experience just how bad the Jeepers Creepers movies have gotten. I get movies like Jason X are laughably bad, but this one actually tries to be good which is sad. None of the kills were even good and I'm assuming that's because it was made $25.

Was pretty hyped to go for a horror movie after a while. To my surprise, this movie made me laugh more than it scared me. The plot was bad, the acting was horrible, the background seemed so fake, the dialogue was something a five year old would come up with, and the creeper looked like an expired cow boy. The movie was an hour and a half long but it felt like 4 hours. It was bad. So bad. Kept waiting for it to get better but nope. Definitely not worth the watch. I saw five people yawn throughout the movie and i even laughed a couple of times at how stupid the dialogue was.

The actors do have potential, it was just the script that sucked.

review_title: Look how they massacred my boy
Let's all pretend this movie was never made and move on with our lives
review_detailed_main:
I'm still trying to fathom how someone made this movie, watched it, edited it and actually thought it was ok to release..... Just horrible. I dont understand what I just watched. It's like you get this huge feeling of - this cant be real -while your in the theater watching this absolutely horrible movie that should and could be amazing in the year we are living in. All the older movies are all way better, hands down, then this one. It's gotta be one of the worst movies ever made. People were getting up and walking out in the middle of it. I don't know why I stayed after the first 30 minutes because from that point on it was without a doubt going to be really really bad.

First thing that was a huge let down was the acting. It seemed like they just put a sign up on the side of the road that said "Actors Wanted" and took whoever said they wanted the job.

review_title: "How do you like those peepers?" Well, i don't...

review_detailed_main:
Jeepers Creepers 4 makes Jeepers Creepers 3 look like Jeepers Creepers. I would rather the Creeper eat my eyes and brain than watch this "sequel" again. Jeepers Creepers: Reborn is easily the worst movie I have ever seen in the theater, as well as one of the worst things I have ever seen in my life... and I once saw a homeless man cough up blood and die while defecating on a sidewalk. And at least that was scary. The only horrific element of JC4 is the abundance of revolting CGI, which would take one out of the story assuming there was any semblance of plot to be found. Alas, the glaring lack of budget is still outshined by the embarrassing lack of imagination. Also, there is no evidence to suggest that anyone involved in the making of this horror hound, as in dog, has so much as seen the trailers for the other three installments, let alone the films themselves. Talk about DOA. They should have titled this one "Jeepers Creepers: Stillborn."

Grade: F.

review_title: Jeepers creepers what a terrible movie.
review_detailed_main:
This was almost the worst horror movie I've ever seen.

People were actually walking out of the cinema half way through.

Don't waste your money on this, go to a stamp collection show instead.

I can't believe they made this movie at all and tried to reboot Jeepers creepers.

The acting wasn't very good, the story was just stupid, it was an absolute discrace to the other 3 movies and the guy who played the creeper needs to go get another career, because he was terrible.

The whole movie was a total let down from start to finish.

I really can't understand why they tried to reboot Jeepers creepers with this waste of time.

Any fan of the other 3 movies would be very disappointed I'm sure.

review_title: If I could give a 0 I would
review_detailed_main:
This is one of the worst film I've seen from a successful horror franchise ever. I was in shock with how atrocious the acting, directing, effects, and story was. The story goes in some baffling directions, it's like the writers had never seen a creeper film in their lives. I literally wanted the Creeper to reach through the screen and rip my eyes out to keep me from watching this eye sore. The green screen is so horribly distracting and just takes you out of it.

AND THE KILLS!!! The kills are even worse. How can you mess that up?! Since when does the Creeper use a bear trap? In a house?! Please just put this franchise out of its misery. No competent director will touch this project with a 100 ft pole.

review_title: This movie is scary for me.
review_detailed_main:
So much better than the third, it's creepy and scary. I don't understand why some people don't like it, but for me, overall it's still fun and interesting.

At first the movie looked uncomfortable. But over time, the movie began to be fun and exciting.

I just want to give you an open mind. Remove all prejudice and go see this movie.

The CGI scene is better than the third, the script is fine, the acting is ok.

I watched this movie till the end. And I like it , This movie was much better than I had expected.

If you don't expect it, you won't be disappointed. Excited to wait for the next installment.

review_title: It was just as good as the others

review_detailed_main:
There are enough reviews already, but I'm going to vent along with yall because the original was so well done and so smart, and it's completely ruined by this one-- so poorly done and so NOT smart.

I'm not going to bother checking, but it seemed obvious that this wasn't the original writer or director, and neither understood what made the first Jeepers movies great: namely, once you've accepted the premise and suspended your disbelief, the actions of the characters have to make sense and be believable. In Reborn they're WAY off, with too many mistakes to mention that make it more and more frustrating, as the whole time I'm thinking, "Why, why, WHY?"

Combined with terrible dialog, silly plot premises and sillier assumptions by the characters, this was a real disappointment and probably the end of this movie series' legacy. In fact, if you loved the first one, you might consider skipping this one because you WILL hate it.

review_title: Scariest part of this movie was the horrible cgi
review_detailed_main: This is honestly the worst movie I've ever seen. Terrible cgi for things that don't even need cgi!!! Who approved this and watched it before it was released and thought it looked ok. Confusing plot, horrible acting and dialog. I don't know why they would ruin the jeepers creepers franchise by releasing this painful to watch movie..spent more time laughing at the movie then I was scared. I myself whose had no film experience or ever owned a camera could've written and filmed a better movie. I honestly have never wanted to leave a theater before and save myself from the pain of watching a movie. This movie should've never been never released. Whoever directed this movie should be handcuffed and locked up for life it should be illegal to make something this bad...shame on everyone involved in this film.

Whatever you do, do not waste your money on this low budget, terrible acting, poor script movie. This film was a train wreck the minute it started. I couldn't even begin to list everything wrong with it or this review would turn into a novel. Multiple people walked out within the first 20 minutes. Than a few more followed. Why did I stay you ask?! Because I really wanted to give it a chance. It was so terrible I had to see if it could get any worse and it unfortunately did.

The acting was embarrassingly bad. The director has completely butchered the creeper we all know and love. I definitely do not recommend this movie at ALL. Stay as far away as you possibly can. Listen to the reviews people!!

review_title: Worse than what the trailer wants to make you believe
review_detailed_main:
The trailer looks a bit cheesy (which isn't always a bad thing) and made me kind of excited for this one, unfortunately the actual movie is a lot worse:

There are only 3 (4 if you count a grassy area) "proper" sets that still look fake (opaque windows with lights behind them), the rest is done through green screens. Usually I don't mind green screen work but in "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn" the fake environments look incredibly bad and it's easily noticable that the characters aren't actually walking on real grass or closing real doors.

The special effects also look terrible, almost worse than in "Jeepers Creepers 1", which was released in 2001.

The script and story are just as bad, cheesy (not in a good way) and don't make sense in places. I can't and don't want to (fully) blame the actors because at least the main couple looked like they did the best with the script and direction they were given.

The only positive thing would the decent make-up and prosthetics used for the creeper if there wasn't real, human skin showing through, like in the "reborn" scene.

And yet there's more to criticize: Apparently the creeper isn't able to count, which you'd think was required for an eternal demon that returns every 23 years. This movie just leaves me wondering why he was "reborn" two years early (2001+23=2024, not 2022). I would have really prefered for the creators to take the two additional years to look for proper locations to film at and practice a bit of CGI work to make the movie look less like a low budget student money-grab and more like the sequel/reboot it wants to be but in this state I'm not sure how it even managed to get into theaters.

I've never left a movie theater early but the only thing that kept me in my seat with "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn" was the fact that I paid almost $10 for the ticket and there's currently no refund policy at my local cinema.

Unless you're into cheesy, bad B-movies, do yourself a favor and rather rewatch the first one.

review_title: Save Your Money And Wait Until It Streams
review_detailed_main: My best friend and I went to watch the movie and let me put it this way. If you are a big Jeepers Creepers fan like me unfortunately you will be disappointed once again. I had some what high hopes for this movie. This makes Jeepers Creepers 3 a good movie for how bad Reborn is. The producer for Reborn needs to stay away from any horror films and stick to comedy. This movie does not give any fear or chills like the first 2 films. There's maybe like 2 jump scares but that's about it. This is definitely the last Jeepers Creepers film that's going to be on the big screen and I'll put money on it. If you want to watch the movie for yourself I'd advise you to not waste your money especially if you like to buy food at the theaters and wait until it streams online. One more thing.. Nobody Can Replace Jonathan Breck as the Creeper and that's that. Thank you Jonathan for your hard work and excellent effort for the first 2 films.

Really, really terrible. I don't understand how you stuff up a movie so badly. The acting is bad but that's not even the worst part. The CGI is an absolute joke, the storyline is boring and the characters are just annoying. This movie did the Creeper dirty by making him a lame and laughable character. This is yet another movie relying on special effects, however, it takes away from the mystery of the original Creeper. It's like the writer never watched any of the others and just winged it. The storyline is just so poorly executed and the script will make you either laugh or cringe. Do not waste your time watching this movie. You will be disappointed. I am astounded it made it to the cinema and I genuinely hope there are no more if this is the standard. If you thought the 3rd one was bad, this is even worse. Injustice to the original. I am both mad and disappointed.

I am a huge jeepers creepers fan but unfortunately this one was absolute trash. Terrible cgi and the creeper was not so creepy. You can definitely tell it wasnt Jonathan Breck playing the part of the creeper maybe if it was it would have been a little better. I also didn't like that they changed his appearance drastically. Storyline sucked and the acting was horrible. I had high hopes. I suggest that you dont waste your time or money going to see this. Certainly disappointed. I definitely would have gave a 0 if I could have. I guess part 3 was the real ending of the creeper. To the director of the movie I'm sorry but that little speech you gave before the movie started too was what also made me know beforehand that it was going to be trash.

review_title: Not as bad as people are saying. The movie was entertaining.
review_detailed_main: I'm a real fan of Jeepers Creepers, and while I agree the movie has many weaknesses, it was quite entertaining and had some pretty decent jump scares. There was an excessive use of CGI particularly for background set pieces, but Jarreau Benjamin did a great job replacing the legendary Johnathan Breck as the Creeper. His performance really carried the movie along. I also see people bashing Timo's direction, which makes no sense to me. There were no awkward camera cuts or weird angles. He did the best with what he was given. Everyone is so negative nowadays. The movie is there for your entertainment, not your opinion on how bad it is. Don't listen to the haters, the movie was pretty good.

review_title: We have a tree bearing fruit

review_detailed_main:
This movie single handley killed the creeper forever and im not overreacting. If we go back to what was the problem with JC3 we will find that the low budget was the only problem and factor that ruined it. JC3 was bad not because the story only (yeah it was bad) but the CGI was so cheap and that killed the movie also JC3 had another story that was scrapped due to budget problems so everything that ruined that movie was due to bad funding thats not the case here in JC:reborn.

This movie JC:reborn is bad in every aspect possible . The acting, the directing, the story , the creeper's makeup and the creeper himself. The problem with this movie is that everyone who worked on it seem to have no clue about the franchise . The general vibe and set of the movie is not related to the franchise by any means this is mixed with how bad the acting was. I dont know are these people even know what acting is . These actors and actresses convinced me that this was a bad youtube parody its not even close to a good youtube parody .

The creeper: what is that? Really what are you doing ? The guy who played the creeper in that movie deserves the worst actor award and he wont win it because he is so bad that they will exclude him and give it to someone else . The creeper was so goofy and funny . The guy who played the creeper apparently didnt read or watch anything about the creeper to know how to act properly . The make up also is sooooo bad the creeper looks dump at best and the people who were in the cinema with me laughed at how bad his face looked.

There's alot to say about this movie but im lazy and i wrote enough but the thing is as a true fan of this franchise and as a man who grow up watching the first 2 jeepers creepers and how the 2 movies remind me of parts of my childhood. This movie is a slap to my face and i hope i really hope the franchise can be managed and worked on by better people. No hate but all who worked on this movie need to be removed including the director if they plan to do a future sequels and i hope they let the franchise rest for awhile to get the proper team to make a proper JC . Respect the fans and the creeper because you done both dirty with this one .

I can not state enough how awful this movie is. As a massive fan of the original, how this movie even exists is beyond comprehension. The CGI is absolutely amateur, the actors are diabolical, the story is 110% rookie. It was not creepy, it was not enjoyable, it was not watchable. The creeper was utter crap and the fact that you see him within the first 10 mins is horrendous. Anyone who has anything to do with the making of this film should genuinely be ashamed of themselves for further wrecking this franchise. If I had one piece of advice for anyone considering watching this, I beg of you not to waste your time. I genuinely feel like I'm owed an apology because I am so angry. Someone needs to do something about the state of the horror genre and movies like this and the recent reboots of Texas Chainsaw Massacre and Wrong Turn are what's wrong. This one is by far the worst.

I liked the first movie and the second.. Such a good movie.

But never did i expect this part to be so terribly bad.

Everything looks like shot in a studio. The creeper looks fake.

The lightning in the background is very strong and in what appears to be a forest. You can tell its artificial light. And its so blurry in the background you can tell its a studio.

I wanted to leave the theatre from the very beginning but i kept myself busy watching. People left.

Apart from that, the script, the characters dont sell the story.

If i could make it short for you: this movie is terrible and i could give it 0/10 i would.

review_title: Literally the worst movie I've ever seen.
review_detailed_main: As a major creeper fan, I'm upset. Everyone who made this obviously knew nothing about the character. The acting, directing, story . All of it is trash . I barely could finish the movie . This movie killed the creeper off literally. Makes JC3 an Oscar worthy movie, at least part 3 felt like a creeper movie. This film (if you can call it that) is a big slap in the face to any fan and just disrespectful to the character. So if any of the crew is reading this. Pat yourself on the back, job well done on setting the new standard of how bad a movie can be! Sorry not sorry. Just don't bother watching this at all.

review_title: JC:Reborn is the perfect candidate for the next Golden Razzies or anti-Oscars
review_detailed_main: Visually, this film is the perfect candidate for several nominations for the Golden Raspberry or anti-Oscar awards, although it may be attractive, the reality is that it has too many points against it. From my humble opinion, this director should not make movies again and he should continue directing commercials and advertising whose works are more impeccable than this one. Jeepers Creepers Reborn is packed to the brim with very bad digital effects, if we learned anything from the third film it is that it is a franchise where computer generated effects detract from the quality of the film instead of adding to it, well that is something that Jeepers Creepers Reborn returns to to confirm. The performances are lousy, I'm even surprised that Dee Wallace lately lends his talent to mediocre productions like this one. The entire cast has flaws except for Jarreau Benjamin who could be a good Creeper and replacement for Jonathan Breck but poor production affected the vision of his character. There are story points that are unoriginal and make no sense, the movie is very incoherent and makes its predecessor (Jeepers Creepers 3) look like an enjoyable movie. I give a big shout out to the entire makeup and prop making team who really did a good job but the direction taken by Timo Vuorensuela makes their work sadly unattractive in the film. Mr. Vuorensuela I wish you could answer my questions. Was there a need to make a cemetery in CGI? Was there a need to make the walls of the rooms CGI? Was there a need for so much CGI? He both boasted and described on his blog that the movie was shot on location in London and USA but it really doesn't look like that. I give it the minimum rating because unfortunately there is no 0.

review_title: If I could give it a 0..
review_detailed_main:
I am writing this as I am sitting in the movie theaters as we speak. This movie is by far probably worse than the long.. excruciating agony of the global pandemic we all had to endure.

This movie is so cheap. And it's completely seen throughout the movie. Nothing was thought out. Minions gave this movie a run for its money.

The only nightmares I'm having tonight is from how horrible this movie was. At least the first 3 had some actual story... and the thrill of Creeper.

Do not watch this movie. Congratulations to the director, you may have actually out did yourself on this one. Please advise, if you're choosing to enter a franchise.. do the characters and the fans justice. Otherwise... they are BEATINGU.

review_title: Worst movie since humans made cameras
review_detailed_main:
Yeah it's true, since humans made cameras and started filming videos I don't think there is a worse movie than this and there will never be. Even 1/10 is more than it deserves because it deserves 0/10 or minus if I can. I've seen a lot of bad movies either due to bad graphics or story line or actors but nothing can be compared to how bad this is.

Story-line is bad, actors are bad and I don't even wanna talk about CGI because I'm sure a 9 years old kid can make better than that. Bottom line is, don't wast your time watching this because i'm sure you will regret it "unless if you wanna laugh at how bad it is".

review_title: This movie was awesome don't believe the reviews
People are taking this movie way to seriously
review_detailed_main:
Not sure what people expect. Nothing is going to stack up to the original. Especially with the budget it had. Was this perfect, nope. But, it's a fun horror movie. They made something with what they had. The acting wasn't terrible. This would be good for Halloween movie. Anyone that has gone to a haunted house is going to know the vibe this movie has. They're just having fun making something they love. Horror. Face it. All but the first JC movie are pretty cheesy. But, that's what I love about horror. People getting paid to do what they love.

The CGI was obvious, but not bad compared to other movies. Would have been better without it and real effect. Unfortunately, those days are gone. We are going to get what we get.

One of the WORST horror movies of the new decade. That terrible Texas Chainsaw film released this year is MILES better than this trash.

I'm in tears writing this because my money deserved better than this hot mess film.

The director should be in prison for the joke he made.

This film was so bad it just made me hate the entire franchise!!! Wow i guess the director does have some talent indeed.

I'm begging you to not even watch this on streaming. This film should have went straight to YouTube. Shame on the director! Shame on the cast! Shame on EVERYBODY!

Somebody green lighted this film wow!

review_title: Jeepers creepers, please gouge out my peepers!
review_detailed_main: This is less a review than a warning. Jeepers Creepers: Reborn is the worst movie, horror or otherwise, that I have ever seen, and I have seen Jeepers Creepers 3. This sorry excuse for celluloid is cruel and unusual torture. I have been to CGI Hell and back and consider it my responsibility to tell of the agony that awaits anyone naïve enough to give up their hard earned money to these thieving sadists masquerading as filmmakers. How dare they give the loyal fans of this once mighty franchise hope only to hurt us again, and the hurt is inexplicably worse. Yes, somehow JC4 manages to outdo the unbearable suckfest that is JC3. And speaking of JC, the SOBs responsible for this disgrace had better get right with Jesus because if there is any justice in this world, the Creeper is real and he's hungry for talentless hacks.

Absolutely horrible. I thought the last movie was bad but this one takes the cake. The plot made very little sense, the graphics were horrible, Jeepers creepers look malnourished, and the frequent use green screen was so lazy. I could go on but I'm mad I even gave this movie a try. I watched it until the end only because I paid $6.99 and I wanted to see how much worse it could get. I actually wish I had come here first to see the reviews because I would have saved myself time and money.

Maybe I should start writing, directing and producing movies because apparently anyone can do it. You definitely aren't missing anything if you skip this movie.

review_title: Fantastic, Beautiful, a Masterpiece- all would be the results if you googled "Antonyms for Jeepers Creepers Reborn"
review_detailed_main:
Appalling.. atrocious.. ungodly awful.. just a few adjectives as to what I would call the movie "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn." An absolute spit in the face move to the entire franchise and their beloved fans. You know what else was a spit in the face? When Imran Adams (Chase) spit in that scene and never wiped it off his face.

A plot with less thought than Sharknado 5 - I think the cost of my movie tickets was equivalent to the money they spent funding the cost of production. An abysmal.

Under no circumstance do I recommend anyone to watch this movie. Your time is better spent literally anywhere else.

This was worse than Texas chainsaw massacre (2022).. and that stunk more than anything I've ever seen.. this blew that out of the water. It's like it was directed by helicopter parents that told their kids they had a cool idea for them to act out for them to film. It's wild someone told them this was good enough to show the world. I honestly can't name anything good about this. There was an outfit montage scene with weird numetal blasting.. the entire cinema just laughed. It's truly unfortunate jeepers creepers became this.. I can't recommend skipping this enough. Literally watch anything else.

As they say in my Spain "Let's draw a thick veil" or what is the same, let's eliminate this hour and 25 minutes from our mind. Let's look at the MIB flash and we will all be happier in ignorance.

This Reborn was born dead and buried, only no one has warned them.

Aside from copyright issues, a special effects budget found in some wallet found in a desert, or a script that smells worse than the dead people in the original film, actors of which I only save Sydney Craven (I want to see her in a real horror film) and Peter Brooke. The rest meh.

In short there are only two parts, the original and a decent sequel, part three and this Reborn don't exist!

review_title: WORST MOVIE IVE EVER SEEN LOL!!!!!!! I WANT MY $15 BACK!
review_detailed_main: GARBAGE. It's actually the worst movie I've actually ever seen in my life from the worst CGI and acting to the plot which has a million holes in it. The budget must have been $20 because it is so bad dude. The CGI is laughable honestly and I'm into some good B horror movies but this isn't so bad it's good it's so bad it's horrible quality. Please please don't see this movie I'm actually begging you. After the sequel this franchise just went down the toilet. It saddens me because every horror movie lately is such a let down and I'm going to stop wasting my money on this crap all together but yes please do not watch this dumpster fire I'll never be able to get that 2 hours of my life back.

Didn't thought it will be of such quality. The element of an interesting story are here and the cast are at there best, also the visual effects were an excellent contribution.

The only thing that let me down is that the movie is kinda boring in some parts, but overall I can say it is really a good and nice movie which absolutely is worth every penny.

It effectively builds up the tension and manages it keep it high for a long time, punctuated with light hearted moments during the stress and very little down time. It does get quite silly in the second half, but it seems to embrace the absurdity which makes the film even more entertaining.

review_title: Will be a worthy VOD viewing
review_detailed_main:
I'm seeing some mixed reviews throughout the webs and it makes sense. I come out on the more positive side. Those super negative reviews are overdoing it.

Am I happy with my premium theater viewing? Meh. Would have been happier waiting for VOD but I was hyped to see the Creeper again.

The acting was good, the directing was good, even the production value was good (in fairness, it was completely shot during Covid). There were some good scares, I like the new Creeper, etc. However, the script was pretty bad. That was the big disappointment and I think that's the basis for all those negative comments out there. It took a while to get to the action and there were a lot of gaps and flaws that were just unforced errors.

But this will make for OK home viewing and a must-see if you are a Creeper fan. There is room and reason to hope for a better script for a sequel.

It's taken me 3 attempts and I still can't bring myself to finish the 'movie'. The casting is bad. The acting is bad. The plot is Bad. The effects are bad. The shots are bad. The creeper is awful. The directing is abysmal.

The only plus here is that it is better than JC3 - although only just. And only because it has a select couple of scenes which grip you for a moment. JC3 had none.

The JC franchise has enough ingredients to do something great again, but after these two films, it just makes the whole situation all the more sad.

This was clearly just a paycheck for all involved.

If there is to be any future to JC now, they need to scrap that this ever happened, go with a new studio and decent budget, with people who understand and love the movie and start again.

Sad sad sad.

There literally are no words bad enough to describe this pathetic attempt at a film!! I can say nothing positive about losing this hour and a half of my life!!

I've seen better fan made movies than this!!

Everything about it is bad, from the attempt at recreating the first scene from the first movie and it never gets better!!!

And having the nerve to leave it open ended?? Well that's extremely wishful thinking from the director!!

The first two are pretty amazing!! Do yourself a favor and steer clear of anything after that!!!

99% of the reviews have been negative and there's a valid reason for that..... This movie is s**t!!!

review_title: Legit the worst movie I ever had to watch
review_detailed_main:
Acting, Camera, Story and CGI were all the worst that I've ever seen in my entire life. It looks like they paid extra to make it as bad as somehow physically possible. They 3D-Animated most of their settings in such a bad way, it looks like students did it. Acting was so bad I had to laugh loudly in the cinema several times. The story doesn't make sense at all, like nothing of it. The director tried to make connections from one scene to the other that were so bad, I don't know how one is able to come up with ideas like that.

It hurt to watch. This movie is literally horror. I'll have nightmares of how bad it was.

review_title: Lmao just pretend they never made this movie
review_detailed_main: Honestly. The first and second were the only real jeeper creeper movies. ** I'm not going to spoil it except say this was the worst movie I've watched in years. I honestly couldn't wait to leave the theater. No real story. Horrible acting. They completely tried to give it a story that made 0 sense. I'm literally pretending this movie was never made because it ruins the others. Honestly don't waste your money going to see it! Honestly it was limited for certain days for a reason besides disappointment. I wish I could get my money back. The originals were terrific compared to this garbage lol. :/

WHAT WAS THIS! No link to the original story line or cast. This movie was just horrible and you can tell it was done in 5 weeks.

I would love to see a jeepers creepers movie that follows the original story line, this movie was horrible and I hope it doesn't effect another movie being made from the original.

Don't bother watching it.

The acting was mediocre, BUT WHAT WAS THE STORY LINE. Utter garbage! What a mockery of creeper.

Few franchises have faced as much negative backlash as Jeepers Creepers and especially the third and fourth movies have been harshly criticized. Jeepers Creepers: Reborn has a worse rating on this website than infamous cinematic disasters such as Samurai Cop, The Room and New York Ninja to only name a few examples. Any reviewer who has dared giving this film a higher rating than two out of ten points has been met with massive negative feedback, no matter how well-written, meaningful and articulate some of these reviews have been. Under grislier circumstances, one might describe such instances as excessive peer pressure, relentless internet bullying and particularly radical bias. Let's not go so far in the case of an underproduced low-budget horror movie but it's already obvious for me at this point that this review is going to be sparking angry reactions. I'm however not looking to get attention, to enrage or to be passive-aggressive. I'm simply putting down my honest opinion on Jeepers Creepers: Reborn.

Ever since watching the first movie about two decades ago, I have had a soft spot for the franchise and have remained a fan for two decades and counting by now. From the start, I was hoping for Jeepers Creepers: Reborn to be atmospheric and entertaining and didn't expect anything more due to the unknown cast and limited budget. This movie has delivered in both regards and even offered some additional quality that was unexpected.

The film's story is simple but efficient. It tells how young adult Chase desires to attend a niche horror convention known as Horror Hound Festival with his skeptical but supportive girlfriend Laine. Chase nervously prepares to propose to his beloved girlfriend while she learns that she is pregnant. The couple wins a fixed competition at the convention that allows them to participate in an escape room activity connected to a mysterious urban legend. Things take a grisly turn when members of the television team that accompanies them go missing. The couple and its companions soon realize that they are trapped in a gigantic mansion and that something very dangerous is inside with them.

On the film's positive side, this movie has a creepy atmosphere from the opening scenes with the sympathetic elderly couple to the flick's final showdown involving the titular character. The film doesn't rely on predictable jump scares but instead works with gloomy lighting techniques, sinister locations and ominous soundtrack. This movie is also pleasantly entertaining in its concise length. The opening scenes go by in a heartbeat and reference the franchise's first film charmingly. The introduction to the film's main characters is just long enough to develop them properly without drifting off into boring stereotypes. The scenes at the festival are colourful, eclectic and memorable. The passages at the cemetery are without any lengths and increase the film's vibrant atmosphere a few notches. The concluding finale at the mansion is creative, detailed and intense. The film has a satisfactory conclusion and then the credits already start rolling. I wouldn't have added or cut anything to or from this film as director Timo Vuorensola deserves praise and recognition for an expert job under challenging circumstances. Other elements that deserve praise in my opinion are the two protagonists who complete each other perfectly and make for a believable, charming and sympathetic couple you want to root for. The acting performances might not earn the cast any nominations or awards at film festivals but they are doing surprisingly solid jobs for this kind of movie genre. The plot also deserves some respect as several side elements such as the references to the first entry in the franchise, the male protagonist's objective to get engaged to his girlfriend and the female protagonist's surprising discovery that she is pregnant are diversified, entertaining and sympathetic. As you can read, this movie has enough strengths to warrant a positive rating.

However, there are obviously also a few downsides. The story around the titular character is obviously quite predictable. The film itself is lacking scary or even shocking moments and could have been slightly more intense and sinister. The movie's low budget is visible in some special effects and would certainly have benefitted from a more generous production. However, all those flaws are relatively small and won't prevent franchise fans from enjoying this film to the fullest.

As you can read, Jeepers Creepers: Reborn is a very decent atmospheric horror movie that should certainly please fans of this particular franchise and independent horror cinema of the twenty-first century in general. Ignore the masses of pessimistic reviews and give this film a fair chance. A trailer might actually give you a good idea whether this film lives up to your expectations or not. In my personal case, Jeepers Creepers: Reborn is a positive surprise and while it can't compete with the first entry, it certainly equals and even outclasses parts of the second and third movie in the franchise. I would like to thank everyone who has taken the time to read my review until the end and given it a rating.

Jeepers Creepers: Reborn was absolutely horrible. It had all the characteristics of a low-budget movie. You could tell when a green screen was used. The acting and CGI were horrible. Avoid this at all costs - even if you're curious about giving it a look. The acting is appalling. The story is appalling. The actors are appalling. The production values are "TV movie". You'll hate the characters. You'll hate the new Creeper. You'll hate yourself for having ignored this warning and wasted your time regardless.

Plot

Forced to travel with her boyfriend, Laine begins to experience premonitions associated with the urban myth of The Creeper. She believes that something supernatural has been summoned - and that she is at the center of it all.

Cast

Scream queen legend Dee Wallace and made by the guy who gave us the Iron Sky movies. Thankfully, no Victor Salva.

Verdict

I was surprised to see another Jeepers Creepers film appear, I'd assumed it was a dead series but when I heard Salva wasn't involved again I pondered whether this would give Jeepers Creepers the renewal it badly needed.

Here we see a return to the formula, it doesn't really deviate, it sticks to the standard cliched'd structure you'd expect and delivers us a very underwhelming, lackluster and forgettable tale while at the same time trying to implement new lore which works about as well as the voodo stuff did with the Halloween franchise.

Reborn isn't bad, it's just so uninspired it makes me wonder why they even bothered. A series I've never been a fan of anyway, this fourth installment makes s me think maybe the Creeper should be laid to rest beside his creator.

Rants

How to save the creeper? He's never going to reach infamous horror icon status at this rate. What could save him? Decent writers, a bit of originality, maybe a reboot, or how about a vs film? Creeper vs Voorhees? Creeper vs Chucky? Creeper vs Pinhead? I usually like those types of thing but I'll admit those are terrible ideas. RIP Creeper, I'll be very surprised if he gets a 5th film.

Breakdown

A few entertaining moments Dee Wallace is always great Very generic Plays it very safe New lore is terrible.

What is this movie? Seriously...what is this movie? Has the ability to make good movies been lost through the generational processes of man where we have lost the ability to make even a kind-of okay movie? JC3 was bad enough, but now we have Reborn.

The most offensively bad movie to be made for at least 3 years. There is not a single line delivered in this movie done right, the writing itself was terrifyingly bad. The make up was painful, the kills were trash. And let's talk CGI, in what way would we have needed to waste money on CG environments. There's real locations out there, but we used CG...why?

In a single word "don't"....just don't, it isn't worth it, not even for a laugh.

Honestly this movie wasn't that bad! Way better than jeepers creepers 3. I give me only 80s slasher vibes. Just good thing to put on when your just hanging around or at work. I think people are comparing this to 1&2 which were really good I deff recommend this just don't worry about special effects. Honestly it's better than rob zombies second Halloween movie or any of the new halloweens. Of you are a true fan and hated the 3rd one you will like this one for what it is. With that being said I'm just getting to the 600 characters and then I'll post you can stop reading but hope you enjoy this..

review_title: Not bad, takes a bit long to get going though.
review_detailed_main:
Easily under-rated simply because people refuse to enjoy the movie on its own merits. Reborn has a very dark atmosphere and characters that are all very shallow but reasonably well acted, much better than most B's.

There is a very strong redneck theme in reborn I guess they figured it would just work being a country oriented horror and its works for the most part but it does tend to distract from the drama and horror of the creeper after a while. More creeper less backstory would have been appreciated.

Where it seems to lack is in either the editing or storyboarding because there is too much content the viewer simply is not interested in going on for much of the time. Everything else seems pretty good to me, music, directing, acting etc. There are tonnes of worse horrors out there.

Just when I thought it couldn't get any worse well jeepers creepers reborn just did it. Starting off the movie with a rip off of the original and might I add a waste of a talented actress in Dee Wallace. The characters were atrocious and the creepers looked like crap. This wasn't scary or suspenseful as the original and this movie makes the third movie look like the shining. I can't believe I wasted my time and my money on this rebooted pile of steaming dog poo. I really can't wait for Friday when Halloween ends comes out. This was really disappointing to me as a fan of the other 3 movie's and whatever you think of the director from the previous films you can tell he was missing from this movie. Skip it.

Timothy Treakle.

What an absolute crapfest. Did no-one watch this movie back and think 'that's not very good is it?'. Why did they even bother to make it?

First off the beginning is practically the same as the first movie, except its a couple of older people. Utterly predictable and disappointingly clichéd.

The characters, especially Chase, are absolutely terrible! The acting is an insult to B movies let alone what you would expect from the Creeper franchise. They were annoying and not believable in the slightest.

There was no direction, the effects were terrible and it was just so boring. What a complete waste, I'm gutted!

They ruined the whole series with THIS. It's an insult to fans. I thought third Jeepers Creepers was not great at all, but this one is BAD. I mean the worst! Everything is terrible here. Please don't waste your time and watch first two movies if you haven't seen them yet.

Acting is poor, dialogs are stupid. But the scenery is so fake it makes you want to squish your own eyes with fingers! And the movie isn't scary at all. They've made a comedy out of it. It's so bad that you want to laugh. Maybe one day it will become a cult classic of worst movies of all times.

Furthermore, it is probably the worst horror movie this year so far.

review_title: They KI:LLED the franchise NOTHING to do with Jeepers Creepers series
review_detailed_main: This should be rated 0 this has nothing to do with the Jeepers Creepers series. The writing is atrocious they couldn't even be bothered to follow the original series how hard is that. Instead they combine haunted house, coven, escape room and whatever else they saw recently into a Jeepers Creepers movie. How hard is it to write something like this. I mean the original films were trash but they look like masterworks compared to this... 99% of movies and shows suck today because the writers suck. They literally do not know how to write anything even in a semi-competent manner. Unwatchable. What a disaster this is.

review_title: The first two were worth watching again. The third one tried to add something new. The fourth destroyed the franchise.
review_detailed_main:
It isn't Jeepers Creepers without Victor Salva at the helm, directing it. Jeepers Creepers is Salva's baby, why someone else is given the director's seat is a mystery. Salva's The Nature Of The Beast 1995 remains his best contribution along with Rites Of Passage 1995 and the cult horror film Clownhouse starring my favorite actor Sam Rockwell(The Green Mile 1999, Moon 2009). He is an accomplished director that can weave wonders onto the screen. He is an A-grade Hollywood director.

But a sex scandal and conviction and imprisonment cut short his career for a while. Afterwards he was never the same. He fell out of grace when he was at his best. We cannot judge him. We can only appreciate what he gave to the film industry as a whole: some terrific movies.

Back to his film. It is about a creature(or demon or a fallen angel) that reappears during a fixed cycle to feed itself from parts chosen from a select and particular group of people it senses fear from. The first two movies reinforce this idea. The third film tried to get into its origins but failed in my belief. Nothing was explained into the origins of the creeper. We are still shrouded in mystery. The fourth installment goes "nowhere".

An interracial couple Chase(Imran Adams) and Laine(Sydney Craven) are heading to the Horror Hound Festival, when Laine begins to experience unexplained premonitions and disturbing visions associated with the town's past, and in particular, local legend the Creeper. Soon they are joined by the Creeper himself, hell-bent on getting his quota of victims. This then is the premise of Jeepers Creepers: Reborn, a feeble attempt at rebooting a franchise that has a cult following.

Verdict: atrocious acting, direction and bad C. G. I. Will make you want to leave the theater altogether. If Salva saw this mess and I bet he did, he'd want to distance himself as far as possible from this. He is too great a director to associate himself with laughable projects like these.

You may also like Pumpkinhead 1988 and The Unnamable 1988 if you haven't seen these already.

I loved the first two Jeepers Creepers Movies (Third one was, meh.) But this instalment just didn't cut it. It had the feeling of having had the crap edited out of it, and at just over 80 minutes long, it probably did. The opening sequence was not explained well, and seemed disjointed from the movie. In fact the whole movie felt disjointed, with half baked ideas not fully realised. Nothing really happens for the first half of the movie, it almost had a made for TV feeling about it. One person disappears just about at the beginning of the film, and apart from a "Where are you?" comment, seems to get forgotten for the rest of the film. There are a few deaths early on, but none are shown on camera, just hands grabbing someone then a puddle of blood. I'm not a big gore lover, but in a movie like this it's part of the fun. The ending is predictable, all in all one to avoid.

I loved it! Starts out similar and better than the original. Brings back memories of watching it with Dad back on Halloween 2001. I liked the heavy duty deuce Creeper truck, and was overjoyed when he brought out his old WW2 ambulance. This Creeper is thinner esp in the back and shoulders. This one looks more like he belongs in Hellworld. He looks a little worse for wear when he comes out of his 23 year shell. This Creeper is not nice looking like Breck's. This ones kind of spiny. The Creeper cult was a little much but they've done that before. The new Creeper was after a bride, sadly he doesn't get one. Monsters always want a human bride. Usually disappointing when they don't get one. This Creeper was also oddly built, can't quite explain. The people could have cared less about. The ending was quite bad too, could have done that alot better. Hope they make more!

review_title: Shoddy, Artificial Looking At Times & Cheap But Still A Fun Low-Budget Reboot.
review_detailed_main:
The first two Jeepers Creepers films are awesome, especially the superior sequel Jeepers Creepers 2, but the 3rd film was horrendous & now we have an even cheaper looking Jeepers film with the rebooted REBORN.

Now, Jeepers Creepers 2 is still my favourite of the franchise because it's so much fun but Reborn is fun in it's own scrappy way.

I totally understand why they rebooted this Horror franchise in order to get away from the disturbing stigma of the previous sicko director. So I'm fine with a remake but the Creeper he doesn't look as good as the older creeper but still not terrible or anything just a cheaper version. Yes this is definitely a very low-budget film & that's fine, i love B-movies & i think they did fairly well here with it's shoddy making. One thing for sure is it's pretty much straight into the monster action & we see the creeper waking up from it's hibernation & that was very cool. It was nice seeing a little cameo from the great Dee Wallace, she's Horror movie royalty. I liked how the film starts as if it's a complete remake of the first & then it flips to it's an episode of something like it's Unsolved Mysteries or something & we first meet our two leads watching it while traveling to Lousiana for a Horror festival. Our two main characters are lovers Chase & Laine & are both decent characters actually. Chase is obsessed with the Creeper legend & within this universe the first three Jeepers Creepers films are just that, films & not real. I liked how this film is set over Halloween & as said the Creeper is decent looking & moves well but just not as good as he is in the first two original films. Imran Adams who plays Chase is actually pretty good in the role & I've only ever seen him in the silly t.v drama series Hollyoaks. Adams plays Chase as a fun horror fan & a full-on geek about the Creeper legend & that made him such a different character for a Horror flick than the usual boring types.

One main problem with it's low-budget is it's artificial look that it often has because of it's cheap CGI & blue screen stuff & it's very noticeable. The horror festival scenes are well done & the escape room, which is a huge old decrepit house where the Creeper hunts & eats his victims & is basically fed people by his Cult fan club. I did like the chilly woods scenes with the Creeper in that environment & i liked the nighttime scenes in the graveyard with it's glowing full moon, it all looks very old fashioned gothic but at the same time you can see it's green screen being used. I do think the production team did the best they could with what they had to work with. Probably the lowest budget of the Creeper films but it's definitely better than the terrible part 3 & it's a nice feeling to know that sicko director Victa Salva had nothing to do with this movie & so we don't get the perverse look at young mens bodies lol that littered part 2. Yeah those pointless shirtless scenes were just weird, Victor loves young men without tops on.

Although the Creeper isn't as neat as the original creation the art that went into him here is still damn decent. This version of the Creeper is more a mouldy brown colour rather than grubby green & he looks more evil here in a darker, more menacing way. Also there's a side plot about sinister satanic cults & voodoo, that doesn't get fully explained or explored. Lets hope there's a sequel to dig deeper into the mythology more. Reborn is a shoddy film but it's cheap 'n' cheerful in a way & definitely a fun direct-to-video horror. I enjoyed it for what it was.

The kills are nothing special at all but the new locations are pretty cool & set over Halloween is definitely a bonus as all the other films are set over summertime.

The two main character are decent & the actors do give it their all but of course we get those that make stupid decisions & stuff that just wouldn't work but all in all Reborn was a fun little horror cheapie & i would actually like to see a sequel.

The first film in the series was decent. The second film was ok. The third was lazy. This one is insufferable.

It very quickly descends into a run of the mill 'teen' horror you've seen a thousand times before. The setting of the horror festival added nothing to it, and felt like a deleted scene from 'Final Destination'.

There's nothing here which would make you feel like you're watching 'Jeepers Creepers'. If ever there was a franchise killer, this is it.

Just an awful film. That's all i can say, but i still have characters to use before i can publish this.

If you haven't seen this yet. Don't.

review_title: After watching this you will start to question every decision you ever made in your life that led to this
review_detailed_main:
Excruciating to watch, it's difficult to find anything positive to say about JPR.

Direction, childish. Writing, infantile. Acting, amateurish. The CGI is astonishingly bad it looks like it was done on an Apple prototype from the seventies.

I couldn't root for any of the the characters so I found myself wanting the Creeper to kill them all quickly so I could get on with my life..

The script is the worst. It's as if an alien had been told what human conversation looks and sounds like and they threw out this shower of shine-ola as 'good enough'. Not to mention the plot conveniences and contrivences that go to make up the 'story'.... Avoid.

review_title: How did this get to cinema.
review_detailed_main:
Seriously this is the worse B movie complete and utter rubbish, poorly acted, no very poorly acted of all time. I guess the new generation will love it and think it's great. But let me tell you and anyone else that reviews this high. It isn't. It ruins the name of the creepers movies (well 1and 2). And should be put in a dark cupboard and all copies destroyed. And the internet destroyed just so nobody can view it online.

Then I've got to keep going to get to 600 and got no more to say. Blah blah blah. Dan now I can't copy and paste on the review page. 609 chars is to long anyway why do that. I we'll probably my last review.

"I need to tinkle tailer my soldier spy". A real line of dialogue from the latest cash grab of Jeepers Creepers.

This is some dire stuff. The idea of the Creeper is great and the first Jeepers Creepers was solid and has become a classic but everything after it has been a downward spiral.

The setting of Reborn is a big problem, it's almost a rush to get to the big spooky house where almost half the movie is spent inside. No Jeepers Creepers movie should be like this. The first, with it's big open roads, made for such a claustrophobic environment despite it's landscape. Here....nothing.

The opening showcases every beat of the original in five minutes with an appearance by Dee Wallace. And it's all downhill from there.

Suddenly The Creeper is just your standard slasher character and will target anyone, especially pregnant women, because that's a thing now. Clearly A Nightmare On Elm Street 5: Dream Child never taught us anything.

The less said about special effects, the better. By the end, most people will have checked out. The Creeper suddenly seems to have some sort of cult doing his bidding which is never brought back up again. Clearly Halloween 6: The Curse Of Michael Myers never taught us anything.

"How do you like those peepers, b***h!". Another real line from the movie....

I'm not going to try and convince you not to watch this movie but I will warn you how terrible it was. The story wasn't set up to take place after the 2nd movie, if so the director didn't watch it, the new creeper is garbage, J. B was way better. Jarreau's movements, acting & new look/makeup don't hold up to what we are used to. This is far worse then the 3rd one, it feels lazy and cheap. The acting is laughable, the casting was dreadful and the story was dumb. I feel bad for Victor Salva, they took his creation and destroyed it. The effort behind it reminds me of the new Texas chainsaw movie but worse.

Don't listen to these clowns who go on about how great it was to offset the low ratings, just because it has horror elements. These guys are what's wrong with the rating system, they don't know what a good movie is. Sure it has blood and weapons and his truck but if that's all you need for a good movie then sure maybe this is for you. Also its not a reboot, its a continuation, this goes to show how knowledgeable some people are. There's a reason its getting a 1 rating across the board, at the end of the day look at the people who took the time to give feedback on how bad it was instead of just rating it, it's a warning.

I would have given this movie 0/10 if I could. I love horror so much but seems like everyone says that these days so take this at face value or don't but at least I can say you've been warned. Maybe you're that one person who will like it and everyone else is crazy. Good luck.

review_title: Not going to lie, this could potentially qualify for the top 10 worst movies created in history of films.
review_detailed_main:
If you're fan of the original Jeepers Creepers, or even the 2nd one, DO NOT WATCH THIS.

I don't usually leave bad reviews on anything, since I cannot be be bothered to spread negativity and generally it's just a waste of time, but I've never been so disappointed with a movie in my life.

The first jeepers creepers was quite eerie, so was the 2nd one. This movie is just a cringe fest all throughout and sometimes even funny. Not once the creeper frightened me, in fact, I felt like if I was out face to face with this specific creeper, I'd be able to take him on no problem.

You can tell when the producers made this movie, they didn't bother to actually analyse the first movie and do any research. They just observed some surface level detail and decided to create a movie from it. I feel like they didn't even watch the finished product themselves, they just filmed a bunch of scenes in a first take format, put them together, and said it's done.

Jeepers creepers 3 is like an A tier movie compared to this, and I could barely finish that one.

0.5/10 movie.

review_title: Bad CGI and bad script are its worst features

review_detailed_main:
Because it slightly shifts from the original format, it is automatically said to be rubbish.

Jeepers is my favourite movie franchise.

It takes us to a new expanded story.

The two main characters are very talented and act brilliantly all the way through.

They have the fantastic acting abilities, adding a few witty one liners.

It takes a interesting turn with a creepy fair.

Of which, I wish I could go to. 😀

It's better than the 3rd effort that was released.

It's atmospheric, creepy and plenty of jump scares.

I enjoyed the building of the main characters and it was done so you are interested in their welfare in the movie. I loved every minute.

Reborn was ok. A scary movie using the Creeper. Instead of JC movie being scary. Could have plugged in any monster would not been much different though the opening played homage to original which I would give an extra 2 Stars for. 6.5 out of 10. Not a bad filler but we need the answer to how does get down frm the barn? Don't expand on the truck, give use 100% Creeper doing his thing. This movie fills in a decent bunch, so fine. 23 years, bring us back some hero's of past to finally put him to rest or not? There is a lot of room for greatness left. Big fan of 1st 2 movies current trend is average at best.

review_title: An hour and a half I'll never get back

review_detailed_main: Ok so it's the worst horror movie I've EVER seen and in the top 5 worst movies I've ever seen. The acting sucks, cgi sucks, plot sucks. Absolutely everything about this movie is terrible. JC 1&2 were great. 3 was ok but this? I had to shut it off 20 min in and even that was 20 min too long. The director Timo Vuorensola needs to never direct another movie again as long as he lives. I mean just look the guy up. He's a Finnish director, actor musician AND HE SUCKS!!!!!!!! Obviously he has never watched any of the original JC movies. Victor Salva was the director of the first 3 and he obviously knows what he's doing. He's won awards and nominations. What has this clown done? Nothing other than some goofy Finnish parodies called star wreck or something. This was the first "big movie" he's directed and thank God there are no other abominations out there. Dude stick to your Finnish rock band if that's what you want to call it and please don't ruin anymore movies.

OMG this movie truly sucked!! Too much CGI and green screen. The original creeper wasn't used. It was just all over bad. Had to take out my phone to watch Tik Tok that's how bad it was! I think what lost my interest was the green screen you could see where it was added and not too mention the CGI I had to do a double take to make sure I wasn't watching a Scooby Doo cartoon. The acting from one character was like she was trying way too hard. And the beginning I won't spoil but they tried way too hard with that to try and recreate the original. It's just sad worst 1 hr and 28 min I wasted on my Sunday.

Where do I begin the creeper alone looks like a terrible Halloween costume straight out of party city the budget looks cheaper than a YouTube video the green screens are ridiculous the acting is awful the movies before look so much better than this I just don't understand why make another movie this bad they should have just left something good alone the first two movies are great and the third one is decent but this should have never came out and don't get me started with the story it makes absolutely no sense overall as someone who loves movies this was just a waste of time and a waste of money I'm very disappointed.

This movie does not even deserve a 2.5 rating. Seems i wasted my time watching this useless movie with pathetic effects. Although part one and two of the title were really great with some real touch of horror and creepy elements. Will never recommend this one!

Horror genre is no more what it used to be! We hardly get a few handful of great horror movies year-round. The basic idea is same and still old-fashioned for all: an evil figure will haunt and terrorise a given group of friends or a creepy home. Originality and creativity is what we are really missing. Horror may contain a mixture of sci-fi, western and other genres which will certainly produce original and fresh content.

Worse movie I have every seen and I've seen some pretty low budget movies. I know there were trying to make it different but damn. The plot made no sense, and the creeper looked so stupid I'd rather if they just never showed his face and kept it a mystery. The beginning was promising but then once it got to the voodoo shop it was just down hill from there. Some actors were okay but most of them were pretty bad. The cgi and film locations were horrible. The movie was so bad I would've preferred if they'd kept it old school and filmed in remote places with a hand held camera Save your money and just leave the franchise alone.

Long since the Justin Long days have passed, we're now into "The Curse of Michael Myers" territory.

This movie borderlines The Room with how incredibly bad the green screen effects were. Like, LAUGHABLY bad. Most of the time I doubted a single cast member was ever on set, or even in the same room as anyone else. Sure, some CGI was bad, but check out the hilarious backgrounds.

For some odd reason, every 23 years there a severe massacre for 23 days and yet no one documents this so no one will believe it whenever the 23 years are up. You MUST get past this huge plot hole to "enjoy" this movie.

The Waving, Smiling Creeper is back. No, not Harvey. Not Kevin. Not even Donald, who incidentally is even more evil that the title character. It's up to a group of Film School Rejects and a First Draft of a Script to take on the villain.

This entire movie is so amateurishly made, I feel bad for the creators. Someone really needed to tell them to slow down or stop before making such an embarrassment as this. And I haven't even touched on the ending.

There's another part 4 that mirrors this film's climax. I'll give you a hint: The Shark is seeking Revenge in the Bahamas. While Jeepers Creepers: Reborn's ending CGI is hysterical, you will LAUGH YOUR ARSE OFF with the final blow. I had to rewind it a couple of times since I couldn't believe my eyes or stop laughing.

Admittedly, there was one fairly decent character (or an actor who didn't know what movie he was in): the aging actor, a couple of jump scares were effective and it's always nice to see Dee Wallace. But, none of these constitute a recommendation. SKIP THIS and let it die for at least another 23 years.

***

Final Thoughts: Much like the Jaws series, each one of the Jeepers Creepers got progressively worse. Though, honestly, I can't remember a thing about part 3. Still, I think 4 is worse.

review_title: Do not support nor watch (especially if you enjoyed Jeepers Creepers (1,2, or 3))
review_detailed_main:
Not written nor directed by anybody interested in the original Jeepers Creepers films, nor anyone even remotely respectful of their fans - this movie was such trash that I will avoid any more Jeepers Creepers material that is released, purely because of how poorly made this was (not even worth laughing at) - You could have thrown that same terrible acting and even the very same moronic plot into any 'horror' film and gotten these horrible reviews, but this antagonist did not have to be ruined for any of the woke pandering that was included.

American) audiences of the original film (Hanlon's razor is bs).

Etcetera post script ad nauseam thank you imbd peeps for letting me resubmit this review (consider adding an 'edit' option?)

review_title: IT SHOULD BE CALLED JEEPERS CREEPERS: CGI ABUSE
review_detailed_main: Jeepers Creepers Reborn is the example of what not to do in a franchise with a basic structure. The first 2 movies aren't much but they were entertaining while Jeepers Creepers 3 was a complete waste... The problem with JCR, beyond an uninteresting and very elaborate plot, is the fact of the excess and oversaturation of digital effects... Mr. Vuorensuela, we know that it is your first horror project, but if that is the best that your talent can do, this doubt . I have no problems with the new design of the creeper because the JC3 latex suit was much worse, however it is not to the liking of many fans and it was obvious how the appearance of the monster caused laughter in the movie theater instead of terror... I relapse again THE WORST OF THIS MOVIE IS THE ABUSE OF POOR QUALITY CGI! Jeepers Creepers' settings are organic and rural and the fact that the director resorted to creating many of them with CGI ruined everything.

review_title: The worst movie of all time!
This might be the worst movie I've ever seen
Good, but Jeepers Creepers 1 and 2 are Better
Look what they have done to my boy

You absolutely ruined the creeper. Why not let the franchise die if you are only going to release this garbage? There is no way this should have been made. review_title: Directed by Timo VuorenCGI - Doesn't work as a sequel or Reboot!

Pls do not watch No Big no.

Hire some good actors, spend more money on the budget and save the 12 year old using photo shop for the editing. And what's up with the whole cult aspect of the things, old mate creeper has started his own crew now ? Comn bring back that original horror

And continue from original story or a prequel to explain how the creeper started.

What happens when you get a Writer and Director who both have no notable movie credits on their resumés, little to no budget and no real understanding of the lore of the original Creeper..?

This movie looked D. O. A after releasing a poor looking trailer, but the saddest part is it was worse than anyone with low expectations expected.. There'll be absolutely NO chance anyone will support a trilogy of this hot garbage.. More likely to support a complete removal of this instalment from any mention of the Creeper in future..

I hope someone in Hollywood with money that actually cares about this franchise can eventually start the ball rolling on an "official sequel" to the first 2 movies..

Reborn is one of the worst movies ever made. It actually hurt watching this so called 'movie'. It honestly feels like the filmmakers went in completely blind ignoring what fans loved about the first two films. It has absolutely no redeemable quilities and the scariest thing about it is that they are actually planning another one! Really?! Common guys do something either original and leave the Creeper alone, or hand him over to someone who actually has respect for this iconic monster and knows the target audience that have followed the series since its conception in 2001.

For now I'll just say, RIP Creeper.

review_title: This movie sucks being back the original!!!
It's not that bad. Much better than the third one.
review_detailed_main:
I wouldn't normally leave a review but the amount of people that have rated this 1 clearly have never seen a bad movie before in their lives. There are so many movies that deserve a 1 rating but this one isn't one of them. Its so much better than the third one. The only issue that I have with it is that the creeper has a different truck (not as scary as the original truck). I would have probably rated this a 4/5 out of 10 but decided to rate it a 6 to make up for all the bogus reviews of people that just have to moan about everything. It really is amazing what people expect from a low budget film.

I personally loved the beginning with dee wallace, shame she wasn't in it more. I would have loved to see gina Phillips return to the franchise but with it been a new director its understandable.

review_title: Complete trash of a movie. Honestly save your money
review_detailed_main: I grew up watching jeepers creepers as a child and actually enjoyed these movies until seeing this one. review_title: Why was this piece of offal not stopped when it was just an idea?
Some missed opportunities, but it's not THAT bad
review_detailed_main:
A young couple travel to a horror festival in the area of Louisiana that's infamous for the legendary Creeper. When the actual creature awakens, all hell breaks loose.

The Jeepers Creepers Intellectual Property (IP) had basically been 'cancelled' due to the sexual crimes of the mastermind of the franchise, which paved the way for this reboot, "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn" (2022). It was made by a small studio in England trying to make a quick buck off the IP. This resulted in the production company of the two previous installments filing a property fraud lawsuit.

The best thing about the franchise is the Creeper, which is reminiscent of the chief gargoyle in "Gargoyles" (1972), just mixed with Jason Voorhees and Freddy Krueger. While people praise the first movie from 2001, it was hindered by its limited cast and Gina Philips was only serviceable on the feminine front. The second one from 2003 tried to make up for it with a whole busload of kids (plus three school employees), but it generally dropped the ball in the female department and, worse, focused a little too much on shirtless jocks, which can be explained by the writer/director's issues (get real). There was also zero depth beyond an evil winged creature attacking a busload of youths.

The third film from 2017 was hampered by an unnecessarily convoluted opening and the Creeper now had an eye-rolling 'Mystery Machine' with built-in weapons and defenses. The latter took away from the sense of genuine horror, but it provided the opportunity for some slasher thrills. In addition, Gabrielle Haugh was the best heroine up to that point.

So, here we are with this fourth installment, which is almost universally reviled. I agree that the story could be more compelling and the flick relies too much on CGI, but it has several highlights: Sydney Craven is easily the top heroine so far; there's exposition on the demonic creature being reborn as a little Creeper; the Horror Hound Festival is a great milieu in the second act; the idea of occultic people worshipping the creature, as well as supplying victims, is interesting; and the story basically ends up being a cabin-in-the-woods flick.

Unfortunately, it doesn't take full advantage of its positives. Sydney Craven could've been utilized even better (not tawkin' 'bout nudity or sleaze) and the horror festival setting could've been milked for more entertainment. Still, there's enough good here to make it my favorite of the tetralogy.

It runs 1 hour, 28 minutes, and was shot at Black Hangar Studios in Lasham, which is a little over an hour's drive southwest of London.

GRADE: B-/B.

review_title: Not the same story line at all....

review_detailed_main: They should have stopped after Jeepers Creepers 2. Jeepers Creepers 3 and 4 is just a waste of time. I thought watching JC 4 would make me forget the non sense story of JC 3, but noooo. Just made me question myself more, "Why did I even watched this?" Oh my goodnesssss. Please, no more JC 5. You are just making a bad name for Jeepers Creepers 1 and 2. Enough of this please. I would like to watch more Jeepers Creepers of course, if the quality and storyline would be like Jeepers Creepers 1 and 2 but men... 3 and 4, you just disappoint us. Please, don't ruin it. "DON'T WATCH JEEPERS CREEPERS AFTER JEEPERS CREEPERS 2."

Was so overhyped, i absolutely regret paying $21 for a ticket to see it.

The acting was horrendous, special effects was TERRIBLE and plot was pointless and you could tell exactly what was going to happen from the start.

People in the theatre were leaving, i however stuck through to see if it could possibly get better but it somehow kept getting worse and worse.

I won't spoil, however there was parts that made absolutely no sense. We did not get scared once! It was more so funny, as the people that actually stayed just laughed through the whole movie with us.

review_title: I wish to rate this a 0.

This entire movie was a letdown. It has completely ruined the Creeper. I would honestly believe this was a high school low budget student film. It was honestly all around awful and I was looking forward to this movie. I honestly wanted to enjoy it but I took everything in me just to get through it. Save your time by rewatching the first two instalments of the franchise because after watching this one, you really come to terms with the fact that the Jeepers Creepers movies have gone into a downwards spiral, getting worse and worse. review_title: I wanted to gouge my eyes out....all the reviews are right.
Not like the Previous Three Films
review_detailed_main: First of all, I loved seeing Dee Wallace (The Howling) in the beginning of the movie. After that scene, not much interesting scenes. The girlfriend dressing up for her boyfriend, then they kiss, then to the next scene. It's like the writer had to fill up time so he puts in this boring stuff. It would have been better, to write a script about how the creeper got this way. Yeah, a Prequel to Jeepers Creepers. Scenes with cult people, like that of "Rosemary's Baby" just wasn't interesting, to me. The main actors were just okay, not great. Yes, definitely could have been better, especially for a Theatrical film. See my: No Sex No Nudity Movies IMDb List, if you like some good ideas for movies to watch.

Before the ACTUALLY movie begins, the director decides to go on a tangent.. At that moment I knew purchasing a ticket to see this HOT PIECE OF GARBAGE, was a mistake. And oh boy was I right. The movie was so cringe. The story was terribly written and it seemed like there were so many situations that could've been avoided. Not once did I feel adrenaline, in fact I had to muster as much strength POSSIBLE to stay awake. I like the concept they went for; however, it was poorly executed. If this crew decides to remake or bring their own twist to a classic, I'll give you some advice... DON'T! And if you do, bless the good people by making this a free release on a steaming platform. Ultimately, I'm not upset the movie was boo-boo, I'm upset that I paid for it.

The acting, directing, producing and even the story is terrible. After watching it til the end, i have many questions crossing my mind for instance, many props used in the movie for no specific reason or back story, and there are alot of scene which is not necessary or doesn't support the story, the creeper was disappointing. I just cant believe i gave the movie a chance and stayed til the end. No offends to the new actors but I wouldn't hire them in any future movies, they need to improve their acting skills first.

review_title: I wish I could rate this 0/10
review_detailed_main: Trash. Another horrible script from the untalented Sean-Michael Argo along with poor direction from Iron Sky creator Timo Vuorensola. What an absolute mess this whole thing is. Completely nonsensical, terrible CGI, zero character development, and green screened to hell and back. Couldn't even build a set for a fake cemetery... The lore of it all is obviously supposed to be in the season of Spring but it's cold in every outside shot.. you can certainly tell each time an actor exhales or speaks. Horrible fake American accents, dull acting.. just entirely uninspired. I do not consider this a legitimate installment of the franchise. Hopefully this story doesn't continue and its out of the hands of this team and company. Jeepers Creepers Reborn is a European imposter film. Highly do not recommend.

review_title: Really bad in any possible way
