review_title: AND I DON'T RATE MOVIES HARSHLY, BUT JESUS..
Not as bad as you would think
review_detailed_main:
Jeepers Creepers Reborn is undeniably a very flawed film, but it is not nearly as bad as its score and the buzz surrounding it suggests it is. It must be stated before anything else that, yes, it does not hold a candle to the first and second movies. If you too are of the opinion that Jeepers Creepers is a riveting horror cult classic, and that its sequel is an enjoyable-yet-ultimately-mediocre follow up, then it is likely you'll find that Reborn ranks somewhere below the passable second film and leagues above the atrocious third film.

Let's start with the good. Reborn has a a solid atmosphere, with beautiful shots reminiscent of that eerie, long winding road from the intro scene of the first movie, and it features curious locales located somewhere in the deep South that can't be found on any maps. It manages to evoke that feeling of "maybe we shouldn't be driving through this place," and makes it easy to imagine that the places you see in the movie are real locations that you could spot while lost on a road trip.

The main attraction, the Creeper himself, was also a highlight of the film for me. While I'm sure many would consider his redesign and overall aesthetic to be divisive at best, Reborn's take on the Creeper managed to be true to the original while also feeling fresh. The film also contains many references to classic horror movies, which is sure to get a kick out of long time fans of the genre. The kills, though they tend to lack impact, are generally enjoyable and more than a couple of them made me squirm.

Now for the bad parts. While the atmosphere was great, the reviewers who have brought up the terrible CGI in this film were not kidding. The worst of it is relegated to cheap-looking CGI backgrounds that I personally found easy to ignore, but there was one absolutely abysmal use of CGI at a pivotal point in the film that was impossible for me to overlook. I don't often have trouble suspending my disbelief when watching horror, but this particular scene was horrendous, and I can only hope it is fixed when the film is released on blu-ray and streaming services.

The plot is mostly nonsensical, and serves only to have our characters eventually find themselves crossing paths with the Creeper, but said characters were likeable and entertaining enough to make me want to see more of them-- namely the main couple, though some of the other side characters were still fun, if one-dimensional. Overall, I am happy that I got to see Reborn in theaters and form my own opinion on it, especially because it is a limited release here in the states. As a fan of the series, I recommend it to anyone who wants to see more of the Creeper, though it is vital to keep an open mind. If you go in expecting a classic, you will undoubtedly be disappointed.

The first installment of this Shakespearean series was really awful. And this one is even worse. I didnt think that could have been possible. I have made a collection of films that are the worst turkeys in the history of cinema and the FIRST one made the list. This one easily makes the list and for good reason. The CGI in the film is laughable, the actors can't act, the director is sleeping in a room somewhere, and the movie looks like it was shot with an apple phone. Other than that, you are more than welcome to be the first idiot in your village to pay money to see this piece of junk. It is for only for perverse reviewers like myself who get in for free with passes.

review_title: The Start of a New Trilogy?

review_detailed_main: What a way to ruin this. The last movie almost did it in, but this is pure TRASH. Awful CGI, terrible actors and actresses, and not to mention the creeper himself looks nothing like he has another movies. What an ending too. Pure garbage. The effects were awful, and had I know this I would have never paid 6.00 to rent it. The original was a fanstastic movie. Good effects, cast and plot. 2nd one was as well. If a dumpster fire had a name next to it, it would be this movie. Nothing made sense either, NOTHING connected this back to the original or provided anymore detail on the creeper of his history. Avoid!! Hour and 35 minutes i'll never get back lol.

review_title: That's not my Creeper, and this movie would kill him if he ate it.
review_detailed_main: If you have any respect for the horror movie legend, don't, and I mean don't, support any type of viewing or profit towards it. I'm a huge fan of bad movies, but this one...well this doesn't even take the cake. I would rather watch grass grow for an eternity in hell than see this movie once again. The main characters are horrible. I understand the under acting in certain parts but after a while it gets old and over done. The previous movies or should I say the great ones atleast made sense and had you wanting answers or cliffhangers. This is a complete disgraceful taste in your mouth. The Creeper wouldn't even eat this movie because it would kill him.

review_title: One of the worst horror movies I have ever seen!
review_detailed_main:
This was a very painful watch. It was very unorganized. For Jeepers Creepers fans this was a hard punch to the gut. This movie completely destroyed the franchise. It felt more like a really bad parody than a horror movie. You can tell that when the producers made this movie, they didn't even bother to actually analyse the previous movies & do their research. It looks & feels like a made for tv movie. The script/story was very poorly written. The computer animated cgi backgrounds are very fake looking & are absolutely terrible. The images torture & destroy the viewer. Dee Wallace is such a fantastic actress but unfortunately signing on to this movie was a sad waste of her talent. The other actors/actresses were just awful & had fake American accents that were not convincing at all. The characters are unexplained as well as dull & uninteresting. The Creeper was the most disappointing. He is genuinely a terrifying character with so much potential, yet fell completely short of that in this movie. His face looked unrealistic, & more like a cheap Halloween costume. He looked nothing at all like he did in the previous movies.

The first three movies were directed by Victor Salva. He's a sick & twisted monster but at least you can say he was a competent filmmaker with solid ideas. Lately with all the horror movie villains getting fresh comebacks it doesn't seem like this "Creeper" will be rising back anytime soon after this atrocity.

review_title: this makes Jeepers Creepers 3 look like a masterpiece
review_detailed_main:
I honestly though that i missed The Asylum logo at the beginning, but nope. Turns out there are other studios producing hot garbage.

It has super bad practical effects, terrible greenscreen. At one point during a bus scene they messed with the lead actors face somehow that it was extremely noticeable.

The practical blood looks bad and the CGblood even worse.

The dialogs and plot is written by a 14 year old it seems. The plot moves forward just because it has to, nothing makes any sense. At least the lead actors did a decent job, or the terrible movie made it look good, just as this makes Jeepers Creepers 3 look like a damn masterpiece in comparison.

2/10.

review_title: Dont assault your eyes watching this.
review_detailed_main:
If you came here expecting a Jeepers Creepers movie, look no further than movie 2.

Jeepers creepers stopped after movie 2. 3 and this one are not jeepers creepers.

The whole premise was about a maniacal psychopatchic demon spawn thing that would kill people and tried to chase people who found out its secret in a small american backwater town.

Great suspense, especially in the police station in JC1 and the in the bus in JC 2.

This movie lacks all of horror flavour of the first and second movie. The creeper is a very poorly glued togeher mismash of a skinny guy, with a fake helmet and CGI wings.

The acting is very poor. And as usual the went down the route of making the female a "girl boss" giving her a "moment".

Poor acting, poor cinematography, blair witch project did it better with a handicam and 100k USD.

This is literally a to dvd movie, dont bother wasting your time. Poorly put together and rushed, jeepers creepers is truly dead as a franchise.

review_title: Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear
review_detailed_main:
Poor writing, poor acting (from the former Eastenders and Hollyoaks stars... oh, and everyone else in this, too), poor direction, poor CGI, poor sound design, poor cinematography...

It's just poor, and that's me being kind.

Clearly no-one involved in this project gave a damn about it, or about the previous movies in the series (by previous movies, I mean 1 & 2, but not 3 ... why should they care about 3, when most of us are trying to forget it?), and it really shows.

This was a quick, phoned-in payday for all concerned, which is a real shame, but to be expected.

If you enjoyed the first two movies in the series, avoid this.

Hell, even if you enjoyed the 3rd movie, avoid this.

Did I mention that I advise people to avoid this?

review_title: Poor execution of something that had potential
review_detailed_main: Good concept but due to a low budget and poor acting the story was unsuccessfully executed and left me fairly bored watching it. The other Jeepers Creepers films (although older) were a lot more exciting and engaging to watch. This movie wasn't part of the initial trilogy and infact sets up for the next set of movies (apparently), however that doesn't excuse the poor quality, especially as the graphics nowadays are so good to live up to and I have to say that this movie did not live up to that. There were many mistakes that I noticed and the accents of the cast kept slipping, ultimately leading to a poor performance. For a low budget movie it is okay and I appreciate the effort however I will not be recommending it to anyone anytime soon.

What did I just watch?..Oh that's right a master class on how to hammer the final nail in the 'how to destroy a franchise' coffin ..with the first two films being fairy credible horror films with some half decent scares and jumps..I know they weren't breaking new grounds in either content or story but the performances were good enough and the horror engaging enough to make it at least worth the watch. I personally was More intrigued with the potential this character had for further films if managed correctly. Then came the third instalment..what a overly lit bag of crap. Who in the hell came up with the idea of having the majority of this film set during the day so we see way too much of this character totally neutralising any sense of mystery or fear for him.

Then we get this this fourth instalment and we see the title 'reborn' . Surely hope is not lost.. surely this means reboot ? Back to basics..back to what worked...nope..instead we get to witness the death of a franchise right before our very eyes. Bad acting and unlovable characters is an understatement and some of the worst green screen I've seen in modern cinema. Use the time this film would take to watch and do your hoovering instead..at least your house will be clean..which more than you will gain from watching this travesty.

review_title: well, they were trying something new, i guess
review_detailed_main: How successful it is sort of depends on how much you paid attention to the previous movies. I thought it was pretty firmly established in the first film that the creeper only kills people after he does some vetting - he has a fondness for people he feels a connection to - ie: he wants their eyes or whatever body part is appealing. That's touched on, but also there's just rampant killing for seemingly no reason at all. I won't go into the "expansion" of the storyline because it didn't make much sense to me. It might have been better to just start another movie franchise instead of ruining the universe of this one. I would have thought at this point they might have tried to do a prequel, since it's never been explained what it is or where it came from. If you have seen the first three movies, stop there and don't bother with this one - it will make you frustrated.

Had a lot of hopes, but they threw out most of the reasons the first few worked, but no. It just didn't work. So many reasons. The first five minutes were fun fit that's where it ends. I'm sorry, but not so much.it had a CB lot of potential, like calling the baddy the creamer and even referencing the first few films as poor recreations, but it just didn't offer up on the delivery. It feels like a poor studio that got lucky and bought up the rights to a pretty cool franchise but then ruined it. We might have been treated to more if the backstory of the creeper that they sort of kind of teased but they don't seem to get the concept of the creeper taking from its victims the pieces if itself that it needed to regenerate.

review_title: Obviously, we've been mugged off by the UK
review_detailed_main:
If you want to know why this movie is a disaster just look at the cast & crew, all foreigners for the most part playing in an American movie franchise. I don't know what's happened to Hollywood, purchased by the UK?, as it appears they have stopped giving any parts to Americans, it's foreigners in almost every major role. The horrible CGI brought to you by India.

10+ Brits, including the 2 main characters, representing Americans, give me a break. Also, is anyone else sick of the constant W/B relationships in everything, almost every commercial, tons of Hallmark movies & quite a few movies.

It's so in your face that I'm convinced it's coming from our own Govt, forced propaganda to piss off the group they are trying to blame everything in America for.

I think its time to stop remaking what was originally an awesome movie. The first 2 movies were scary, and the creeper in the first two was disturbing AF! They have failed with everything after the first 2 movies. What ever happened with bringing Trish back and her teenage son? That would have been good! As long as you use a scary creeper. We are only 14 minutes into Reborn and we can't believe the JOKE that is the creeper. He isn't scary, so disappointing. We can't believe we just rented this. (LOL-jokes on us) Guess we will buckle in for a comedy. (Insert eye roll), it's Halloween tomorrow we were supposed to be watching scary movies today.

review_title: The Creeper Comes Out of Hibernation Weak and for Nothing
review_detailed_main:
The creeper left some nice nostalgic horror memories, having seen the first two installments at the age of 9 or 10, and a few times since then. To this day, I believe Jeepers Creepers is the one horror franchise with a villain whose mythology is ripe for expanding, if only creative minds are attached. Even the third part was, although cheap and a lackluster, reasonably fitting the modus operandi of the franchise, but this... This is a sad, or annoyed, or just an emotionless *sigh* on every possible level.

. Timo Vuorensola, director of the pretty fun nazi-moon-base comedy "Iron Sky", together with the unknown Sean-Michael Argo of D-grade horror background, has set out to truly disappointment horror movie lovers and piss off franchise fans... After a pretty weak intro, there is still the vague smell of hope in the air, but that is slowly but surely destroyed by a myriad of factors. While the FX team and actors do their best, including my favorite one by Peter Brooke, given "standout performance" for, unfortunately, most likely an unintentionally funny character, "Jeepers Creepers Reborn" sinks helplessly during the entirety of its 88 minute runtime. I did not like where the plot was going, and it ending nowhere didn't help either. The whole essence here is heavily clichéd, and through lackluster carnage creates no fear, no suspense, and the characters can hardly be felt for. They even managed to lame down and take away what little character the Creeper had, not a fan of his new design either, although I have to admit it was at least slightly better than I was expecting to see. All the old, more iconic characteristics of the Creeper and the movie universe are rehashed, and any new ones only raise eyebrows. There are overloads of digital effects, obvious green screens - visually, nearing the end, the film feels artificial in a funky, bad way. The atmosphere is full flat, silly or even cringe, besides some unintentionally funny momentums. The night lighting is terrible. The gore is cheap and plain underwhelming. The action is unengaging. The dialogue is boring. The characters cannot be rooted for, or did I already said that? It's just... altogether bad. However, it was a funny kind of watch, for I was relieved too, because I truly expected something awful upon seeing those 2.9 stars (2.7 now as of writing this).

. It's really, not trying to be offensive here, quite a dumb movie. Very likely would be more liked had it not taken a half-decent horror franchise's name and character. It feels like a strong attempt for a very bad horror movie. I even saw it on the big screen, having gotten tickets for next to nothing, and it still most definitely was not worth it. The mom sitting beside me, who thoughtfully took her two ~12 year olds to see this masterpiece, was shaking on every cringe jump scare. Glad she enjoyed it. I can imagine this being a moderately cool film if you have less than 100 horror movies under your belt. My rating: 3/10.

review_title: No great loss had I skipped this film.
Woah, it really is that bad
review_detailed_main:
Ouch, this is probably one of, if not the worst movies i've ever seen. I've seen alot. It is terrible in every department, the sets, the creeper, the actors, the story (or lack thereof). This literally ticked zero boxes for me. Obviously this isn't one to watch at the cinema, but it is one to totally ignore when it arrives to streaming.

I don't follow producers or story writers, but whoever is in charge of this movie needs to find a new career pronto as this one is NOT for you. Abysmal in every sense of the word.

The trailer made the movie look passable, but this was trickery. You will be disappointed.

Worst movie ever from that Saga. 50 minutes to start something that was a kind of joke. I lost.1hour and a half of my life.

Strongly NOT RECOMMENDED, better that watch the first one or the second one.

Creeper was a kind of bad CGI and that was not need it, an example of that is the first and the second movie which were the best ones.

This is a worst movie that should not be put on cinemas or any kind of video, should never see the light, its a kind of joke to the horror film. Neither despite as comedy or bad comedy.

Bollywood will made it better than this producers and writters.

It seems that the director was the first job... and fortunatelly for all... the last one.

review_title: America has decided it will destroy every good movie
review_detailed_main:
OK, I had so much text, but then I realized there is no point. So I deleted it I am going to make it short(er) I love horror movies (or good movies in general)and most of the time I am very forgiving. For example I love first trilogy of Star Wars, I like second trilogy and despite of everything I liked even the last trilogy. But I had to set my mind "I am watching sci-fi, not the star wars anymore" so I wasn't paying attention to the story or characters, but I watched only CGi and action scenes... same with my top movie Alien, watching Prometheus was very disappointing but when I watched it second time and I knew it is not about Aliens I like it... as a Sci-fi movie. Same with Resident Evils, Predators (exception last one, that one is really good) etc etc... so I can enjoy a movie even if it does not follow "original " in everything.

But what I can't stand it stupidity in movies. (outside movies as well).

Terrible and illogical characters and their stupid decisions (pull over a car, get out and go to pee so far, that you need GPS to find that car again) or going alone during the night somewhere, of my "favorite", fist fight with monsters... that is always "WOW" ... etc, of course I hate childish adaptations (like for example for me LoTR in amazing, Hobbit is terrible and Harry potter is disgrace, Punisher is amazing, Batman vs Superman is amazing, Dark Knight is amazing, Logan is amazing etc... but Antman, or new Thor or Wonder woman etc... it is for 9 years old" You will find every single of these stupid aspects here unfortunately.

Combine these things with almost all the time terrible CGi (to be fair, some scenes looked decent) and "broken" bad guy, in this case Creeper (who doesn't simply follow what he was last 300 years or so) and "incredible" fighting scenes with ... OMG, I have to stop... Simply... this was bad, terrible and whoever directed, 23 people each day should have peepee poopoo on his hands and society must forbid him to go to the water for the rest of his life!

Creeper is not creepy anymore, because he looks more human than people here, he is not capable of killing anymore because he has become musician and ... damn, I have to stop.

But good news... it can't be worse, just can't. If there is gonna be another one, it must be better... and another good news, suddenly part 3 looks much better now that yesterday :D.

Terrible movie, but that's part of its charm. If you go into watching this knowing it's awful, it's not that bad. I mean it's still bad. But if you can laugh at it, it's enjoyable enough to finish. The acting is terrible, the editing is bad, the cgi is awful and the story is not worth the money they spent to make this movie.

I saw in the goods that this movie is supposed to be set at night and yet there is always a bright light shining in the house and I couldn't stop seeing it. Like the light is so bright. Just overall a terrible movie but if you are looking for a bad movie to watch so you can laugh at how bad it is, this is the one for you.

review_title: Jeepers Creepers, why do they make these bleepers?
review_detailed_main:
Discount Wayne Brady and his girlfriend discount Mia Sara head to Creeper land to attend a stupid Halloween festival. Apparently the movies before this where just films, even tho everything is the same.

There's some useless dialogue and yadda yadda for no reason until the discount lovers win a raffle to an escape room where the Creeper lived, or something? I don't care.

They're supposed to be filmed for an internet video and are taken to the most well lit abandoned house outside the most well lit cemetery at night.

It's about here the short story starts that seemed to be written by a ten year old describing what he thinks a horror movie is.

Of coarse Creeper shows up, they're locked in a house with him and a predictable outcome is played out.

Some of the acting is fine, some God awful, but mostly it's just the bad script that ruins this one. It's not scary. It's not funny. It's not gory. It's just a complete waste of time.

review_title: I mean, what did you expect?
review_detailed_main:
So the headline. I mean c'mon, you perfectly knew it'd be terrible, - amateur chroma keying (one part has a black guy's head visibly cut off), cheap sets, awful acting, horrifying CGI (just look at the white bird), bad sound (dialogue volume is unbalanced), rushed editing, bad pacing, you name it. It's got it all.

We just need to accept the fact that we won't see any decent sequel of Jeepers Creepers for at least a couple of decades. Unless time passes by, everyone forgets about the franchise and someone finally remakes it in 2040 as a timeless classic with a budget that's not laughable. Until then I wouldn't get my hopes up, pal.

review_title: Sometimes it is better to just leave a dead franchise alone...
review_detailed_main:
Well, I can't exactly claim that I was harboring much of any high expectations for this 2022 fourth movie in the "Jeepers Creepers" franchise, since the three movies before this weren't exactly milestones in horror cinema. But of course with director Timo Vuorensola's 2022 "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn" being a horror movie that I hadn't already seen, then I had to sit down and watch it.

The storyline in "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn", as written by Sean-Michael Argo, was pretty straight forward, but at the same time it was also a very bland and generic storyline, even for a horror movie. Sure, if you enjoyed the previous three movies, then you might get a kick out of "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn".

The acting in the movie were fairly adequate. Aside from two short appearances by Gary Graham and Dee Wallace, then I was unfamiliar with the cast ensemble in "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn", and I will say that taking the script into consideration, then the cast put on good enough performances.

Visually then "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn" was adequate. The design on the creeper was good, and it was nice that you get to see so much of the creature this time around. But at the same time, a lot of the background scene looks horrible fake.

"Jeepers Creepers: Reborn" is watchable enough for what it turned out to be, just don't get your expectations worked up. And while I managed to sit through the movie, I can honestly say that I am not returning to watch "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn" a second time.

My rating of "Jeepers Creepers: Reborn" lands on a four out of ten stars.

review_title: Not a Sequel and NOT Good
review_detailed_main:
Firstly, I loved the first Jeepers Creepers despite the writer/director's very murky past. Seen it maybe 7 times.

The sequals never lived up to the original and there is a 4th in production for many years but never made yet. This is not a sequel. It's sort of a reimagined version. Oddly, they mention the first three movies early in the film.

It starts off rather promising but soon unravels into abject stupidity that makes no sense. The original had this hook that the creeper cant kill you if you show no fear of him. No more. He's basicaly the predator now in a really really really bad costume.

It STINKS.

Very disappointing.

review_title: Too much cast and useless special effects. The first one was simple and awesome

review_detailed_main:
More like a Asylum Films rip off than a Jeepers Creepers franchise installment.

The very few redeeming features were the couple of throwbacks to the original... but other than that.. man oh man what a horrendous dumpster fire this was.

For the love of all things remotely good do not bother wasting your precious time on this crap.

The scenery was all CGI.. and I mean all CGI! What's wrong with filming in a busted old house?!? Get some actual character into the movie not greenscreen the whole thing..

Acting was atrocious on the most part.. Story was barely present at all.. like the thought the Halloween fun fair was a cool setting and just strung a few random ideas together to get to a ending.. more plot holes and conveniences than a Convenient Plot Hole Convention.

Another good franchise ruined. Hate it.

This movie was horrible and not in a good way. 5 minutes into the movie I questioned my poor decision of going to watch this at the movie theater. I should have never wasted my money. I would feel better burning my money or giving it to Joe Biden's campaign. The actress in this movie should have just applied for a PPP loan and kept it pushing. The script, the actors, the cinematography everything was bad. How dare they send this not to a straight to TV movie? What happened to the franchise? This was bad, cheap and had nothing to do with the first three. This movie is like that bad essay your English teacher told you to start all over.

review_title: I like bad horror movies and I did NOT like this
review_detailed_main:
For someone that has seen many a D rated horror movie in their time and enjoyed (most) of them I can tell you.. this movie is not redeemable and would not recommend.

The acting at the beginning is terrible and then it moves into the movie and you think "oh, that makes sense... it'll improve now". No. It does not.

There wasn't even any comic relief or outrageous death scenes to bring it back from just being a terrible movie. Also, the absurd CGI?! What even was that & why was that necessary???

I'm a fan of the first 2 Jeepers Creepers and was sincerely disappointed that this followed those, let's all just try and forget this exists and move on.

Hard Pass.

review_title: Mistakenly watched it thinking lead actress was Wes Craven's daughter

review_detailed_main: This movie has the feel of some of the other flops, reminiscent to the bazillions of Amityville horror sequels. Pointless, cheap, disjointed, insulting to the original ideas, dubious acting, and worst of all for this one perhaps: ZERO chemistry between the interracial (standard fare) couple. Also, notably distracting was all the fake skies and fake scenery as some kind of painted wall or CGI'd green screen insert. Not convincing at all, and most likely the nail in the coffin for this franchise. The first 2 are pretty good, and even great in some ways. 3 is ok, suffering budgeting issues. This one should have been abandoned or made into something else.

review_title: What the heck did I just watch
Not as bad as what one thinks, but very flawed...

review_detailed_main:
Woke generation once more, the first jeepers creepers was amazing and a great movie, the actors did the whole thing, the creeper was also amazing and the psychic woman was really awesome.

I had serious doubt when they did a jeepers creepers 2 but Ray Wise was casted and made the movie a bit better, it was far from perfect but still watchable.

For some odd reason jeepers creepers 3 was very low budget and it showed poor quality in every possible way and a total failure 3.9. This new installment was clearly rushed and they added the woke generation to it, what a big surprise.

A sort of a failed remake and quit useless in the already tired series. All in all stick to the first one and forget whatever was made after.
